noun.description: A level paved area or platform next to a building; a patio or veranda.
examples: breakfast is served on the terrace

noun.description: Each of a series of flat areas made on a slope, used for cultivation.

verb.description: Make or form (sloping land) into a number of level flat areas resembling a series of steps.
examples: the slope had to be terraced

origin: Early 16th century (denoting an open gallery, later a platform or balcony in a theater): from Old French, literally rubble, platform, based on Latin terra earth.
